name: Finances insufficient to meet repository commitments
description: Finances are insufficient to adequately resource each of the business’s integral activities.
notes:
- Does the repository undertake budgetary management?
- Is financial investment necessary to achieve repository objectives?
- Within its current business model, is the repository capable of self-sustainable income generation? 

The full description of this risk has been obtained from examples provided in DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment, March 2007, Digital Curation Centre (DCC) and Digital Preservation Europe (DPE), http://www.repositoryaudit.eu/
preMitigationNotes:
- Repository operating on an annual loss
- Insufficient resource to facilitate every intrinsic activity
mitigationStrategy:
Avoidance strategies:
- Develop self-sustainability with charged-for services
- Seek assurances of level of budget In the event of risk’s execution:
- Solicit additional funding to enable achievement of organisational objectives
- Revise objectives if funding stream is insufficiently flexible
- Maintain contingency fund where possible to meet shortfalls
identifiedBy: DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment
